Subjective: Headaches x2 months. Worse in past weeks. Right side, sometimes generalized. Negatives: No trauma, no radiation. Associated: Occasional nausea, no vomiting, light sensitivity (glare). Triggers: Light, talking. Relievers: Paracetamol (rarely), Ibuprofen (effective). Family history: Migraines (father), cluster headaches (grandfather). Social: No smoking, occasional alcohol. ICE: Requests migraine vs. cluster headache diagnosis and management.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50 (regular). Neurological: Cranial nerves intact, fingertip-nose test normal, arm/leg strength normal, Romberg normal, gait slightly off. Impression: No focal neurological signs.
Assessment: Suspected migraine. Ruled out: Cluster headache.
Plan: 1. Education: Review migraine info on thuisarts.nl. 2. Acute treatment: Paracetamol 1000mg 4x/day at fixed intervals + Ibuprofen if needed. 3. Diary: Track headaches, triggers, relievers for 1 month. 4. Follow-up: Reevaluate in 4 weeks with diary. Safety net: Return sooner if worsening or changes.
